IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. This has identified a piece of equipment called a transformer that needs replacing and upgrading. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future. To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off and upgrade the transformer. We will remove the existing one and install a new one on the same day. During this time, you will be connected to a generator to provide you with electricity whilst we carry out the works. To connect and disconnect the generator we will need to switch off your power temporarily. This work is taking place at Joseph Wilson Industrial Estate on Millstrood Road.

This work is taking place in the Blind Lane area.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: **These works were previously planned but were cancelled due to a storm** We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place on Private Land on Woodway.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 10:37 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers reconfigured the cabling on the underground network in the Darnley Road area. We have now restored power to all but one property who we will be in touch with directly. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that a power cut can be difficult, and I'm sorry for the length of the time you were without your electricity. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Thanks for bearing with us over today.

Our specialist cable jointers have so far been unable to pinpoint the underground cabling fault, so they have instructed our digging gang to excavate our cabling. This will allow them to cut our cable, and using specialist equipment, test each side to help narrow down where the fault lies.

Our estimated time frame doesn't need to change currently, and we'll continue to keep you updated, but our team are always here on 08003163105 from any phone if you have any questions. Sent by Will at 09:49.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our relief team of engineers are beginning to arrive on site to locate the fault on our underground network and carry out repairs. At this stage we don't need to change the estimated time frame and I will continue to keep you updated with our engineers progress.

If you have a vulnerable person at home, please call us on 08003163105 and we'll see if we can provide any additional support. Sent at 08:06 by Will
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 10:45 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers connected a generator to our network in the Horsham Lane area. We believe all power should now be restored and back to normal running.

If your power isn't back on or you are still experiencing any issues, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have advised that an existing generator currently on the network needs to be adjusted as well as the new on attached to the network. Due to this unexpected delay we have had to make another slight adjustment to our estimated time frame and we're now aiming to have the power back on between 11:00 and 12:00.

I know another delay is frustrating; our engineers always try to give us the best estimate that they can but due to the safety elements of working with live electricity, sometimes they have to adjust their repairs at short notice.

I'm sorry if this has caused you to change any plans you've made, but we'll be here to update you until the lights are safely back on. Sent at 09:52 by Will.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry if you're still having problems with your power this morning, our engineers have advised that whilst they continue to try to locate the issue on our overhead network, they will be using temporary generators to provide power.

We have these on site now and are sending specialist engineers to connect them for us. At this stage we're estimating to have the power back on between 10:00 and 11:00. I'll continue to keep you updated with their progress but in the mean time, if you have any questions or concerns, don't hesitate to call us free on 105. Sent by Will at 08:27.

Steps.Message:
Hi, this is Talie from the messaging team at UK Power Networks. I'm sorry for the power cut today; I know the lights going off can be disruptive.

We know that some customers affected by todays power cut may have had other issues recently, and I appreciate this is frustrating. High voltage cabling can cover a wide area, so sometimes properties very close to you may have had power cuts that you didn't experience.

I know you may not have had any previous power cuts, but if you have, we often get progress updates from our field staff management about investigations into repeat issues, and our Customer Services team will try to contact everyone affected by them to explain what's happening.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Talie at 16:00 - We can now confirm that all power in the Lullingstone Park DA4 0 area should be back on. Our engineers have diverted power around the overhead cable fault. However, due to the location and complexity of the issue, we have also used temporary generators to restore power to the last of the affected properties. This will provide power until our engineers plan in and safely complete the full repair, which may take a few days.

We're really sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused and the length of time you've been affected. If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi, it's Talie from the messaging team at UK Power Networks. I understand how difficult it can be without power and the additional worries this can bring.

For both our business customers and those at home, we will work as quickly and safely as possible to restore supplies. If you need any additional support or have any concerns, please call us on 105 or tweet us @ukpowernetworks.

I will personally continue to keep you updated with our progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lisa at 18:04 - We can now confirm that all power in the Aylmer Road area should be back on. The recent issues were being caused by an unexpected underground cable fault, which our engineers have excavated and repaired.

We know this has interrupted your power several times, and we're sorry the power cut today lasted longer than the others. We don't expect this issue to affect your power again, but we'll monitor the situation closely. Rest assured our staff will work around the clock to get your lights back on.

If your power isn't on, or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105, free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lisa at 17:30 - Our digging team are progressing well with excavations to expose our cabling so repairs can begin. Excavations can sometimes take longer than expected, depending on ground conditions, other utility equipment like gas and water pipes, parked vehicles, or local traffic.

At the moment our estimated time frame of 17:30 and 18:30 hasn't changed, but as our staff are busy working with live electricity we need to wait until they can safely stop work and contact us with the latest information. Once they do, we'll update you further.

Our team are always here if you have any questions.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 07:52 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Sometimes we can't restore everyone this way, so we're also sending staff to check our equipment. Sent by Lisa at 17:07 - Engineers are on their way. At this point we think the issue is a fault with equipment in your local substation in the Rucklers Lane area. We didn't know this was going to happen, so time frames we provide throughout are estimated and are subject to change.

Our estimated time to have power back on is currently between 20:30 and 21:30, but after we arrive and assess the situation this may change. The reason for this is there can sometimes be a more complex underlying issue found by our engineer's tests which may take longer, and if not we may get power back on sooner.

All of our texts are written and sent personally by our team, and we'll let you know once our staff arrive.

Steps.Message: Sent by Talie at 17:45 - Our engineers are on their way. We believe the issue is an underground cable fault that initially interrupted power to 200 properties. However, we have managed to divert power back to some properties, so 67 properties are still affected. Specialist engineers from our control room will continue to divert power remotely, so your power may come back on at any point. Sometimes we can't restore everyone this way, so we're also sending staff to check our equipment. We're currently estimating power will be on between 20:30-21:30, but this may change depending on what our staff find. Power back on? To stop receiving texts, follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Otherwise, we'll keep you updated.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team
